children: A 29-year-old man returns for evaluation of recurrent painful oral ulcers, knee pain, and fever. He was diagnosed with his second episode of uveitis 1 week ago. For diagnostic purposes, his arm was pricked with a sterile needle 48 hours ago; the results are
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

The most likely diagnosis is Behçet syndrome, an inflammatory systemic disease associated with pathergy (an inflammatory response, such as a papule, to skin prick with a sterile needle). Behçet syndrome is characterized by recurrent, painful oral and genital mucosal ulcerations, inflammatory eye disease (panuveitis, retinal vasculitis), and pathergy.
